about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

about.name: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

hasPart.assesses: Collisions are more likely to happen when: | Collisions are more likely to happen when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

suggestedAnswer.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.

comment.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.

suggestedAnswer.text: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.

comment.text: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

comment.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

comment.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

answerExplanation.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

comment.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when: | Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

hasPart.name: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

about.name: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

hasPart.assesses: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: | You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

acceptedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

answerExplanation.text: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

comment.text: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: | You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

hasPart.name: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane:

about.name: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane:

hasPart.assesses: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane: | You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If making a right turn, you may enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway. Drivers of motor vehicles should not enter a bicycle lane at any other time.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you drive more slowly than 15 mph.

comment.text: If you drive more slowly than 15 mph.

suggestedAnswer.text: No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

comment.text: No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.
Whenever bicyclists are not present.

acceptedAnswer.text: No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

comment.text: No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

answerExplanation.text: If making a right turn, you may enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway. Drivers of motor vehicles should not enter a bicycle lane at any other time.

comment.text: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane: | If making a right turn, you may enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway. Drivers of motor vehicles should not enter a bicycle lane at any other time.

hasPart.name: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are:

about.name: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are:

hasPart.assesses: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are: | It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

comment.text: On a lighted street.
On a freeway.
In fog.
In fog.

answerExplanation.text: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

comment.text: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are: | Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

hasPart.name: Reaction time is slower after:
hasPart.assesses: Reaction time is slower after: | Reaction time is slower after: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Alcohol slows your reflexes and reaction time, reduces your ability to see clearly, and makes you less alert. As the amount of alcohol in your body increases, your judgment worsens and your driving skills decrease. You will have trouble judging distances, speeds, and the movement of other vehicles.

comment.text: Drinking alcohol.
Sleeping.
Working hard.
Drinking alcohol.

answerExplanation.text: Alcohol slows your reflexes and reaction time, reduces your ability to see clearly, and makes you less alert. As the amount of alcohol in your body increases, your judgment worsens and your driving skills decrease. You will have trouble judging distances, speeds, and the movement of other vehicles.

comment.text: Reaction time is slower after: | Alcohol slows your reflexes and reaction time, reduces your ability to see clearly, and makes you less alert. As the amount of alcohol in your body increases, your judgment worsens and your driving skills decrease. You will have trouble judging distances, speeds, and the movement of other vehicles.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Reaction time is slower after: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your:

about.name: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your:

hasPart.assesses: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your: | Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.

suggestedAnswer.text: Left, your right, then your left again.

comment.text: Left, your right, then your left again.
Right.
Left.

acceptedAnswer.text: Left, your right, then your left again.

comment.text: Left, your right, then your left again.

answerExplanation.text: Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.

comment.text: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your: | Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.
